I contacted the hotel the next day and although they offered a weak apology they offered no compensation for the inconvenience. They said they were only protecting themselves. What type customer typically stays at this place if they are so concerned about people bolting without paying their bill?? In addition they have charged me for both nights, even though I left at 2am after the night manager offered no apology for the inconvenience, and I was too uncomfortable to stay. I contacted the Calistoga Chamber of Commerce who were also appalled and suggested I write a complaint. Done!! For $170 per night there are many B&B's that are less expensive and far more appealing!!

Reviews.Title: “Dr. W is the BEST!”
Reviews.Author: FunTravelGuru
Reviews.Content: Hospitality, cleanliness, and efficiency are what we expect at all the properties where we stay and this was no exception. The welcome and general niceness was terrific both at the hotel and spa. This is a very 50s spa and its mudbaths are quite an experience. Once inside the mudbath, you feel like you're floating in space and just when you think it's really time to finish the experience, the attendants are already helping you to the next step. I had never done a mudbath before so I was very open to trying it and I'm glad I did. In the end, I would rave more about the massage by Katherine -- she really knows how to find the points that need attention and fix them. (I get a massage at least 2x a month so I know masseuses). All the rooms in Victorian house have been re-done as the hallway still had the "new-carpet" smell that I happen to enjoy. The room was clean and efficient and while they have brand-new flat-screen TVs, we didn't even have the time to turn it on. Housekeeping never barged in on us (imagine!) and it was as if they knew exactly when to come and clean. The market next door is superbly cute and wonderful. The meals that we did not have down the road in other towns, we had in Calistoga and it was simply great to walk to any kind of cuisine we chose. (Tip: Huachinango is red snapper in Spanish and Vallarta's Mexican food has a whole red snapper meal that is a total steal at $11.) This is, by far, one of the best values in Napa Valley and so long as you don't expect a modern-day spa and resort like the Westin or Ritz-Carlton, you will be very pleased with how smart you feel after saving all that money!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: OregonSweethorse
Reviews.Content: Able to get us a room on saturday night, without a reservation at their Hideaway Cottages. Rooms are clean, very quiet, very, very comfy. Full kitchen with utinsels, lovely gardens. We came in fairly late and they still made arrangements at a competitor for massages. The only negatives are no spa treatments available at this site, though there is at their main site, and a bit spendy, but considering a saturday night stay, not too much of a flinch.

Reviews.Title: “Best in Calistoga”
Reviews.Author: Anipss
Reviews.Content: This is an awesome getaway. You will not be disappointed. The hospitality is amazing from the front desk, to housekeeping, to management. I am fussy about staying in hotel rooms with regard to comfort, cleanliness, and amenities. This was a repeat trip for me, and I have to say the rooms are always luxurious and clean. The beds are comfortable and the bedding inviting, which makes me look forward to my stay each time. This is the only place I would consider staying while in Calistoga. My only regret is not planning ahead to allow for more time in the pools and receiving spa treatment.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Flappy72
Reviews.Content: Excellent value, quiet, clean, comfy room. Hotel is right on main street of Calistoga. Got a big kick out of the retro american motel style. Hot springs water fed swimming pool is open till 10pm, great for a sunset swim. Can take a mud bath on site....not sure if it's worth $80 to sit in a bath of warm compost but it is surprisingly relaxing. Spa has definite retro look too though, don't expect anything too fancy.

Reviews.Title: “Just about perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Spacecaydet
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Dr. Wilkinson's for three nights during a tour of wine country in August 2007. From the tripadvisor reviews, we knew not to expect a five star hotel but a clean, affordable accommodation (considering the area), central to Northern Napa and literally steps from Lincoln Ave in the quaint town of Calistoga. First the good, Dr. Wilkinsons has three mineral pools ranging from and indoor jacuzzi temperature pool, to two outdoor pools one heated and one closer to the natural outside temperature. It's safe to say that you'll find mineral spring water to bathe in that will suit your temperature preference. The room was impeccably clean with a small but versatile TV that unlike many hotel/motel sets allowed us to plug in our portable DVD player. Though small the toilet and shower area were both as clean as the rest of the room and are also separate from sink area to allow for more efficient use of facilities. We stayed in a courtyard one room which was about as close as you could get to Lincoln ave. That being said, the walls were not thin so road noise (Lincoln isn't very busy anyway) wasn't a problem nor were voices audible from the courtyard. Step out into the courtyard and lounge chairs as well as cannopied tables are available to sip that wine you just purchased during a long day of tastings. By this time you probably have multiple wine glasses from your winery tours but just in case they stayed in the car, Dr Wilkinsons ensures clean wine glasses are placed in your room daily. To close out the good section....LOCATION! Calistoga is a sleepy LITTLE town in Northern wine country. The only negative about Calistoga is that the retail shops close relatively early and there may not be as many dining choices as some would hope. Dr. Wilkinson's is right on Lincoln Ave and only a few seconds walk from the three or four block long strip that contains everything to do in town. Walk out of Dr. Wilkinson's and turn left and you run into a bike path that is suitable for a good 5 mile out and back run or a trip to the nearest hiking trail that will take you to heights overlooking the valley. Unfortunately, I can't comment on the spa treatments because my wife went down the road to Indian Springs for her mud bath and massage during our stay. Few more positivies: Dr Wilikinsons is about a 1.5 miles from Clos Pegase one of the best kept secrets among wineries in Napa Valley, 15 minute drive from the petrified forest (no need to see it twice but definitely worth the trip), and only about a 5 minute drive from Old Faithful geyeser of California. Wilkinson's is only about a 2 minute walk from great coffe and breakfast at the Calistoga Roastery. It beats Starbucks ten times over. Negatives: The rooms are not new. The decor can use some updating and the facilities would benefit from general renovations. The carpet was starting to look old and the small tiled bathroom with stand up shower would fit nicely in any 60s era movie. Large parts of the outdoor pool area are blocked from the sun for significant parts of the day, which may require some jockeying around to ensure you capture that even tan. The rooms aren't exactly cheap for what you get but remember, we are in Napa Valley here so if you think about it that way the rooms are very cheap for the location, and this location is GREAT!!! I'd stay here again and recommend it to all. Clean, comfortable, and central would be the best way to describe Dr. Wilkinson's. Calistoga no doubt sees it's share of tourists but the town is so welcoming and unassuming that you feel at home and are likely to see as many locals as fellow travelers roaming the streets on a war summer evening.

Reviews.Title: “far from tranquil”
Reviews.Author: daytripper64
Reviews.Content: My 1st visit to Calistoga was met with anything but tranquility.!Having booked my reservation with a person as suggested on the webpage after giving my creditcard and name to book a 2 room reservation, I was not given a confrimation number 1st part of the problem. When i showed up for my reservations not only did they say i didn't have any reservation ?? but asked if i was sure i was at the right motel. Needless to say i was turned away because they where full that night and so was every hotel for 70 miles which i ended up in nappa valley . I was promptly billed for the 2 rooms by tuesday morning after the holiday. The owner whom would not compare my card to a reservation that did not check in (as i stood right there at his front desk with the same card billed ),which happen to be my reservation put under the wrong name! So at DR Wilkinson even if you try to check in and are the card holder paying for the rooms , you can"t stay but you sure can Pay! The ower of the motel see's nothing wrong in this checkin and billing policy and will not refund the charges. I have reported him to the BBB and Chamber of Commerce of Calistoga. Would not recommend bad business practice here!

Reviews.Title: “Better than we imagined”
Reviews.Author: lala184
Reviews.Content: You will love this place! As we drove down Lincoln Avenue, we were looking for a big, bold sign to welcome us onto the property. When we finally saw it on our left, it wasn't as loud as we imagined. We were greeted by Sadona in the registration office, who was just as friendly in person as on the phone. We booked the "mudly in love" package, so we were ready to see what "the works" was all about! Neither of us had been in a mud bath before, but I had read all of the trip advisor reviews before we went. The spa was no frills- at 2:00 on the dot, Lucia (a spa attendant) introduced me to what would be my home for the next couple of hours. The mud was just as expected-- it didn't smell like roses & I felt like I was floating on hot jello. The mineral bath & towel wrap were relaxing, but even more relaxing was the massage that Sara gave me. I would definitely recommend getting the hour massage - I tried to switch from the 1/2 hr to 1 hr, but they were booked. Room 26 (in the courtyard) was ready for us after our spa treatments. My first thought when we walked into the room was "wow, this is dark," but it was perfect once the curtains were opened and the lights were on. It definitely had a '70s feel to it, but it was very clean & comfortable. The only thing we'd recommend would be to replace the A/C units- the heater (it was in the bathroom, so we just closed the bathroom door while we slept) was really loud. Overall, we loved this place - it's in the perfect location in town. We'd definitely recommend staying at Dr. Wilkinson's, as well as going to Brannan's for a drink and barVino for dinner!

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: neitzjl
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Calistoga at Dr. Wilkinson's. We wanted to do a mud bath but they only do them during the day -we preferred to visit the wineries then. The hot pools were nice. The room was very average but it didn't cost a lot either for Napa standards. The staff was incredibly unhelpful. We asked the receptionist, a Swedish girl, a variety of questions and got the same answer- Google it or map quest it at the computer in the lobby. She couldn't answer basic questions about places in Calistoga. We tried to print the directions, computer wasn't hooked up to a printer but "we can write them down." When we asked if there was some else around that could help us more she directed us across the street to the visitors center that was closed (thanks for your help). Fortunately the people who worked their arrived early that morning. They were over the top helpful and friendly. We had breakfast at a great breakfast joint - Niccola's where they made us sandwiches for our picnic later that day. Overall, thought Calistoga was a bust and wished we would have driven back to Napa for our last night in wine country.

Reviews.Title: “Flashback to the 70's”
Reviews.Author: groovinpinky
Reviews.Content: Whoa, we didn't know we were going to be traveling back in time when we booked our room at Dr. Wilk's. So, I will agree the check out time was a bit late and I am not sure if b/c we checked in early that we got the funked out 70's room or what but it was all too weird. What was even weirder is that the cleaning crew cleaned non-stop! It makes me think they are spending their time and money on cleaning and not updating. I also noticed how odd it was that our sink area was so low, and I am 5'2". It was in a nice location and had some places within walking distance. Next time, we will stay in the St. Helena area.

Reviews.Title: “Could be so much better”
Reviews.Author: MyBoysRule
Reviews.Content: Just returned from two nights at Dr. Wilkinson's for what was supposed to be a great and relaxing celebration escape. The potential for this to be a great hotel is all there but there were simply too many "small" problems to ignor. Pros - Fantastic massage, great service in the bath house and the BEST facial ever. Very nice pools. Cons - Check in time is very late - sometime between 3-5 pm with no guarentee of when the room will actually become available. Rooms are dark. Something is just "off" - hard to put my finger on it. I called at 3:00 to say that we were 45 minutes away and to confirm that our rooms would be ready. I was greeted with a "not sure, we'll do our best." We decided to make a wine tasting stop and arrived at the hotel at 4:30. The rooms were still not ready! Not only that, but no one could actually tell us when the rooms would be ready. There was another gentleman in the lobby who said he had been waiting for over 3 hours for his room. We were told that we were welcome to enjoy the pools, which was great, but the only place to change is the lobby bathroom which is rather inconvenient. Our rooms became ready just as we changed into our swimsuits (we would have waited is someone could have told us it would only be 10-15 minutes). The rooms were very clean, although somewhat drab. The "Bungalow" we booked with a kitchen was very dark, the bathroom sink didn't drain well and the kitchen was very minimalistic - right from the 70's with a refridgerator that was not quite as cold as it should be. The double queen room we booked was nice although the shower was very weak. One very nice surprise was that the managment placed a lovely bottle of wine for us in the room as it was my mom's birthday. We ended up having a problem with the bungalow and having to move to another room for our second night. Although the staff tried to be very polite it definitely cut into our day and the entire experience left us feeling more stressed than relaxed. The one upside is that the room we received - queen with kitchen - was much nicer than the bungalow. We were compensated for the inconvenience - which was very nice - but I would have rather not dealt with moving rooms. Basically, the property and the staff have great potential but small things kept creeping up that prevented us from truly enjoying our retreat away. One more note - although the bath house serviced were FANTASTIC and the staff very friendly, this is not a spa! It is much more clinical and less private than any spa services I have ever experienced. If you can get past that you will love it, if you are expecting a quiet, surreal, candlelit massage and spa experience you will be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely swimming pools”
Reviews.Author: SussexUKTraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Dr Wilkinson's for one night on August 6th. The three swimming pools including the indoor large spa whirl-pool were very nice. We didn't use the massage/spa facility. The hotel room was OK although a bit small with way too much furniture making it feel even smaller. The bathroom was also small with shower and no bath-tub. Calistoga is a lovely place to visit we wished we'd spent 2 nights there. Fantastic choise of restaurants & close to lots of wineries. We visited Sterling & Beringer vinyards which I highly recommend. Overall a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Old School Luxury”
Reviews.Author: sinner5
Reviews.Content: My wife and I did the "full works" for 89 bucks and 129 respectively (she had the massage, I didn't. I was very worthwhile. No fancy distractions, no dimmed lights, etc... just good value, careful attention to detail and friendly service. Just remember, If you've never had a mudbath the sensation is a little bizarre at first... That and mud has a funny way of getting in the most embarassing places.

Reviews.Title: “Relaaaaax!”
Reviews.Author: rrleisurelady
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night with "Summer - better than others" hotel package including "the works" at the spa the afternoon we checked in. We upgraded to 1 hr massage for +$40 each person. Spa and rooms weren't fancy, but clean and quiet. Staff was polite, skilled, and helpful. All facilities are older (as is this community), but clean, with up-dated bedding. No restaurant on premises, but several within 1-5 blocks walk. A nice grocery with well-stocked fresh deli right across the street. This was a girlfriends' de-stressing getaway and it was WONderful! Service and rooms were above average for a 3-star, older location.

Reviews.Title: “No fun”
Reviews.Author: visitorwest
Reviews.Content: Went expecting to relax and enjoy- No ammenities- like bottled water- slipper- Low end- nowhere I would return to- The mud was not local- it was Peat Moss and no special healing powers- it felt awful. I would steer clear and enjoy a better- cleaner- place- here they put them thru the motions to get them in and out!!! visitorwest

Reviews.Title: “Great location, enjoyed the experience”
Reviews.Author: Rebekajean
Reviews.Content: After consulting TripAdvisor I chose this spa for the downtown location and the spa choices. It is an older property but for the most part it was clean, roomy and the beds were comfortable. It was within walking distance of downtown, had several on premises pools to choose from and the staff was very friendly and helpful. My adult daughter and I were on a road trip from San Jose, CA to Brookings, OR to Redding, CA to Morgan Hill, CA visiting family. We decided to take a side trip and have a spa experience in the wine country. Neither of us had been before so we didn't know what to expect. The prices were within reason, $150.00 per night plus the spa treatments, the room was older but clean and the spa experience was positive. The spa facilities were older but clean and the staff friendly and helpful. Yes, the mud smelled a bit and the time spent in each area was short, about 10 minutes, but it was our first time and we had nothing with which to compare. We did realize that a hotel where they didn't accepted kids would have been more relaxing but we were given another room without delay after seeing a noisy family with 3 kids tromping up the steps to the room over our original room. Both rooms were a good size and had 2 queen beds, a small bathroom with a single sink and a stand up shower. Our only problem was the a/c blowing bits of something black all over the white bed spread but the front desk attended to the problem without delay. I may try another spa when my husband and I return to Calistoga but would consider returning here if the price stays reasonable. All in all, a positive experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but...”
Reviews.Author: 06Mexico_Lover
Reviews.Content: I have been a regular visitor to Calistoga for over 10 years and have always enjoyed the convenience of the hotels on Lincoln Ave. You can walk to breakfast and/or walk back to your room after a night out on the town. Dr. Wilkinson's was always a nice place to stay because of it's location and because it WAS half the price of many of the other neighboring properties. My recent visit was such a disappointment - the room we had was in a corner with one bed, which would have been fine, but it was like a tiny cave. The noise from the upstairs neighbors woke us up every night and then the "campers" in the courtyard were out every morning with their kids screaming at 8 a.m.! AND the Dr. was no longer a bargain - it was only about 15% less expensive per night than Indian Hot Springs! So bottom line, my advice: 1. Stay at Indian Hot Springs or another newer property. 2. If you have to stay at Dr Wilkinson's make sure you get a room with 2 beds updstairs (this will guarantee you a decent sized room). Also, the Dr's Victorian is ok, but the last time I stayed there about a year ago, the self-closing front door slammed shut at all hours of the day and night. 3.Have your spa treatments at Indian Hot Springs. I have spa'd at about 5 different palces in Calistoga and always end up there. The Dr.'s steam room is like a closet, the mud is smelly, and the massage just so-so. At Indian H.S. the service is great, the facilites are fist class (though older, too), and are super clean. As a side note: I've done the couple's treatments at Roman Hot Springs too and it's not too comfortable. You sit in your robe in a co-ed waiting room about the size of a small walk-in closet in between each treatment. You'll love Calistoga, though; it's small and quaint, but the people are friendly the food is good to great, and you can really unwind. Happy Travels!

Reviews.Title: “Great value and a great time.”
Reviews.Author: GreatButty
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a night whilst visiting California. We found the hotel in a guide book and looked on Trip Advisor and were happy with the general reviews and wanted somewhere that was good but not extortionately expensive. Some of the Spa's in the Napa Valley seem to charge you twice, for the room and then a lot for the use of the facilities, Dr Wilkinsons was not like this. We booked via the hotel directly and got "The Works" Package, which was a nights stay, a treatment that included the mud baths each, spa and massage, free robes each and a bottle of wine, all this for a total of just under $400. The facilities may be a little dated but are clean and represent great value for money, we were impressed with the large room and super king bed and all the staff. There are also 2 outdoor and 1 indoor pools to use which we took advantage of. All and all we immensely enjoyed Dr Wilkinsons and would recommend it to anyone who wants a great relaxing day or two in Calistoga. The town itself was nice and quaint, though it wasn't that lively in the evening when we went, though we found a nice restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Doc's place!”
Reviews.Author: CrabGuy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited Calistoga in mid-March, as part of a San Francisco/Napa Valley getaway to celebrate her 50th birthday (we traveled from Virginia). No visit to Calistoga would have been complete without getting "The Works" at the good doctor's spa. We stayed in the Best Western Stevenson Manor, just up the road (see related review), but we have stayed at the spa's motel on past trips and were very satisfied with the place. As usual, we found the spa treatments to be wonderful and reasonably priced. The staff is professional, gracious and accomodating, and the facilities are very clean and well-maintained. This was our fourth experience with Dr. Wilkinson's over the course of 15 years. Since his passing several years ago, his family has worked hard to maintain the high standards he set for the business. I recommend Dr. Wilkinson's to anyone planning to visit Napa Valley. If you're looking for luxury and sky-high prices, there are many places from which to choose. We will stick to Dr. Wilkinson's.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service & Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: PamtheSailor
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff was accommodating on our room choices. The Spa staff were amazing and made us feel very comfortable. The ability to move from our room to spa and back discretely in our robes was important to us. The ability to walk from the hotel down the street to world-class restaurants was also important. We can't wait to make the trip again! Thank you to the wonderful folks who work there. Pam from San Clemente!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty and run down”
Reviews.Author: Acrophylos
Reviews.Content: My partner and I booked a room with couple's spa. Turns out, the only thing 'couples' about the spa is the scheduling - men and women are in separate areas. However, all are treated equally: Dirty run-down rooms, paint peeling, all-around mediocre experience. Rooms are 70's vintage run-down. At $80/night it would be fair for the area. At $180/night it is an infuriating rip-off. Rooms aren't even clean, much-less maintained! I hope that someone that cares enough to restore things will buy the property soon!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this resort!”
Reviews.Author: Chevygirlmalibu
Reviews.Content: My stay at Dr. Wilkinson's resort was very theraputic and relaxing. I loved the mud bath and massage. The location of this resort is close to restaurants and shopping all within walking distance from your hotel room. The hotel was very comfortable and cozy. Can't wait to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Love Dr. Wilkinson's”
Reviews.Author: MNnice
Reviews.Content: On cold Minnesota mornings we often wish we were in Calistoga having the "Works" at Dr. Wilkinson's! We have stayed at Dr. Wilkinson's for years and wouldn't consider staying anywhere else in Calistoga. The rooms are so clean and comfortable, the staff (we see the same staff members year after year) are always friendly and helpful. Tha spa treatments are always a highlight of our trips to the wine country. The location is walking distance to wonderful restaurants and fun shops. Dr. Wilkinson's has a good thing going! That's why they have been in business for 54 years!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Dr. Wilkinson's Hot Springs Resort!”
Reviews.Author: Mtwoman
Reviews.Content: WOW!!! What a wonderful hotel! Everything from the reservations directly at the hotel - the staff was great, the room was nice - clean, bed was very comfortable, bedspread was nicely decorated. The pools were the best - the temperature was perfect - nice and warm - great since it was so cold outside! A very relaxing birthday weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Whatta steal!”
Reviews.Author: LisainCA
Reviews.Content: Just returned for a two day, one night visit to Napa with friends from Chicago. When we were making our plans, we considered many of the high-end spas in Calistoga. However, after reading reviews of Dr. Wilkinson's and doing some price shopping, we decided to take a chance on this retro motel with a fantastic reputation. We were not disappointed. The rooms were very kitchy, but clean as can be. The beds were over-the-top comfortable, with the softest duvet sets (I love duvets because they are easy for the facility to wash! Who knows WHAT's on comforters!) The indoor hot tub is the largest I've ever seen, accommodating 36 people. We had a blast, after a great dinner in Calistoga, bouncing between the indoor tub and the outdoor mineral springs pool. The mud bath treatment and bathing ritual were to-die-for. We left the facility feeling so refreshed. The staff, from check-in, to the mudbath attendants and mausseuse, were so friendly and courteous. The only thing I can say that the place needed were robes in the rooms. It was cold bouncing between the pools and our rooms and the robes would have greatly enhanced the stay. Plus it would have been nice to saunter over to the spa in a robe, rather than getting into street clothes.

Reviews.Title: “The Absolute Best!!!”
Reviews.Author: MikeandRose
Reviews.Content: My family and I have been going to Dr. Wilkinson's for quit a few years now with good reason. We are always treated greeted as welcome and treated well during our entire stay by the entire staff from Sal and Martha the Mud room staff to Mark Wilkinson the owner himself.

Reviews.Title: “Long Time Happy Customers”
Reviews.Author: California_Locals
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I make it a point to visit this spa every year and have for over 15 years. The facilities have always been comfortable and well-maintained. The treatments are excellent. We alway choose "The Works" which includes the mudbaths. They aren't going to be for everyone, but we recommend giving them a try. Very relaxing. If you are looking for a very upscale spa experience and are prepared to spend the money, you may want to look elsewhere. However, if you want a quality spa experience at a reasonable price in a location that is outstanding with dependable and professional people and service, then Dr. Wilkinson's Hot Springs is an excellent choice - mud or not!

Reviews.Title: “Details of our Spa Retreat”
Reviews.Author: Grandstrand
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with the motel. The property is old, but very well maintained. The motel appears to have been restored. I can not say enough about how clean and orderly the staff maintained the property. The plants and flowers placed thoughout the motel and pool decks created a very charming atmosphere. The staff swept the walkways and pool deck every morning. Again, very clean! Now for the spa. I can not compare the spa to any others in the area, but I will stay that I was dissapointed in the appearance of the spa facilites. Felt too much like a high school locker room. All the flowers and greenery outside, but very little in the spa.????? The spa service was excellent and the massage was the best I have ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Jet Lag Cure”
Reviews.Author: crankyoldbroad
Reviews.Content: I think Dr. Wilkinsons is great. The location is perfect, you can park your car and forget about it all weekend. The staff is always friendly in the office and in the spa. We often try to stay there before returning home from the airport. The rooms are spacious and comfy, overlooking a nicely planted patio area. They have two pools at different temps and a huge hot tub/pool. The best part is the mud bath that soaks all of the tension out of your body. It looks wierd and feels great! The Doc's not fancy, but it's nice and comfortable. We have been going there for 28 years and look forward to many more!

Reviews.Title: “Great motel and spa choice in Calistoga”
Reviews.Author: i'm_a_carolina_girl
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at Dr. Wilkinson's on our journey through wine country. It's a true motel, with outside room entry, but that's half the fun. The neon lights and looks really resembles a 1950s-style motel. The rooms are plenty nice and big. The beds have fluffy down comforters, which I really appreciated. Separate shower/toilet room from the vanity area made getting ready much easier, especially with two people. The air conditioning wasn't on when we got there -- you control it yourself in your room. It took a little while for the room to cool down, but it was never uncomfortable. The courtyard/pool area is nice. We used the indoor hot tub/pool and one of the outdoor pools (there are three total). Breakfast is not included with your stay, but great breakfast spots are just a couple of blocks down the street. We ate at Sarafornia's and really enjoyed it. Great breakfast at a great price. A good dinner spot within walking distance is Brannan's. Expect to pay $15-25 per person for an entree. Food and service are top notch. My husband and I both had "the works" spa treatment. Allow two hours for this treatment. You start with a 10-minute soak in the warm mud (very cool experience if you've never done it -- you feel suspended in the mud.) followed by a 10-minute soak in a personal jetted tub filled with lavender bath salts. It's then off to the steam room followed by rest time (literally -- you get to just lie down and rest before your treatment continues) in a private area before your massage. My massage was the best I had ever had -- ask for Roy. He really listens and applies appropriate pressure to make it comfortable for you (I usually have to tell people to add more pressure -- with him, I had to ask him to back off just a bit. He can really work that stress out of your system!). You'll feel like a million bucks when you leave. My husband and I would definitely stay at Dr. Wilkinson's again!

Reviews.Title: “DW's: Excellent value, believe the reviews”
Reviews.Author: mx
Reviews.Content: I travel a good deal and depend on the TV user reviews to select hotels. Thus I was a bit concerned about Dr. Wilkinson'ss (DW): there was something strange about the range of comments. The large majority of positive reviews were punctuated with real flamers. It made me wonder if the rank (#2 in Calistoga) had been manipulated. Anyway, rooms were scarce. DW had space. I decided to take a chance. Affter a day in DW's I say: Believe the good reviews. True, the place is modest, with a retro feel. Yes, there are "cinder block" structures. But the enitre facilitiy has been remodeled; the cinderblock is attractively painted (it's actually a "cinder brick" construction); every building I saw is well maintained; and the open spaces are are landscaped with well tended plants, flowers and palm trees. This is not a luxury spa, but it never pretended to be that. It's a quite, restful place for value-conscious people with IMHO more than enough room and comfort. It features three mineral baths (hot/med/cool); the hottest pool is indoors and open till 10 PM; a full assortment of "treatments;" plenty of comfortable chairs and recliners; good, attentive service. Also: DW's is right on Lincoln Ave. right, a half-block walk to the best restaurants and shops. Some of the complaints about the mud baths (in prior reviews) are just crazy. All mudbaths smell. No one changes the mud after each bath. The mud baths at DW's are what they should be--hot theraputic mud. Mine was tended by a knowledgeable attendant who applied the usual cold cloths to my forehead and dabbed some aromatic oils on my face which counteract some of the odor--a real nice touch. I have been to Calistoga about a dozen times, but this was my first visit to DW's. Even with all of these compliments, I still prefer the Calistoga Hot Springs on Washington, located just a block away: CHS costs about the same; it has a little more room and all the mineral baths are outdoors. But I have to say that DW's is a close second and an excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “good for the price”
Reviews.Author: winebadger
Reviews.Content: The First time we stayed at Dr. Wilkinson's was four years ago but the same time period (first couple of weeks of August). The old school charm still existed but this time we were in a hotel room instead of a bungalow. The room was clean and large with a king bed, table and chairs, two night stands, etc. with still lots of moving room. My biggest complaint has to do with the families with little children that seemed to take over the pools for our entire stay. My husband and I don't remember children last time - in fact it seemed as if all of the Napa Valley was overrun with families with little children from the pool to the wineries. Not exactly the romantic getaway we had expected. We do love the location of Dr. Wilkinson's - the main drag in Calistoga, walking distance to several good restaurants, although not the draws like Tra Vigne and Greystone. Sarafornia is a great breakfast joint where locals and tourists hang out. We also enjoyed the easy access to the Silverado Trail which allowed us to avoid most of the St. Helena traffic. The price is the lowest we could find in the Napa area which is also nice. Neither of us are in to spa treatments but there seemed to be a bachelorette party there for the weekend taking full advantage of all of the spa treatments so I will assume they are good.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Dr. Wilkinson's Report”
Reviews.Author: lindaerik
Reviews.Content: We will make this trip a yearly event. The resort is very clean and restfull. The spa treatments are excellent. The people working there are very nice and helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot for a Pick Me Up”
Reviews.Author: SFM14
Reviews.Content: A great, economical "take a break from wine tasting" spot. Not pretentious like so many spas, Dr. Wilkinson's is an old fashion hot springs resort with clean, modern facilities and a very polite, professional staff. The price to value ratio is very good. I have recommended Dr. W's to friends and look forwarding to returning in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Facial, The Best!”
Reviews.Author: Beth527
Reviews.Content: A good three day get-away with just a few exceptions. The best: the most relaxing and best facial I've ever received. Wonderful customer service from Anna Marie. My daugher and I will go back just to book time with her and it's a 160 mile one-way trip for me. The motel itself, sparse and in need of updating. We paid $174 a night and it seemed a little high for what we got. And take your own favorite pillow as the ones supplied aren't very comfortable. If you have a bottom floor room be prepared to hear anything and everything from above. Front desk staff very accomodating, but the staff at the spa itself, need just a little reminder about customer service and follow up. Some personnel in mud bath/bath/sauna area looked totally bored (put out?) with their tasks at hand as a couple of them never looked you in the face and smiled. It was over 100 degrees the days we were there and the pools were a nice reprieve from the heat, a little crowded at times, but very enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “The pools are awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Alexandria-family
Reviews.Content: This is not a luxury spa resort, more like a Dr's office as the name suggests. Basic, clean, comfortable accommodation, but the pools are fabulous. There are three pools, warm, warmer, warmest! They are heated by a geothermal spring - don't miss the Geyser nearby. I thoroughly enjoyed my mud bath - although there was little privacy. Staff were very professional. Afterwards visited Sterling Vineyard - this has cable cars to take you to the top of the mountain - perfect with kids - and I still got to do the wine tour and tasting.

Reviews.Title: “Best facial ever!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Dr. Wilkinson's Hot Springs Resort, a very clean and charming facility. The facial, performed in a charming Victorian cottage, was awesome. Anna Marie is the best - her technique, and the products used were outstanding. Having had many facials, this one ranks as one of the best. Furthermore, this simple retreat is great for relaxing in the mineral pools, heated to 103 degrees, inside or out, after a day of wine tasting in Napa. I highly recommend Dr. Wilkinson's and the charming town of Calistoga.

Reviews.Title: “Moderate hotel with great pools & location”
Reviews.Author: 1buckley
Reviews.Content: Just returned from three night stay. This is generally a very basic 2 or 3 star hotel. It is 52 years old and has been maintained well. The rooms are clean but are old and due for updating in some areas. We had a king patio room which was roomy. The bathroom has only a shower that is very small and leaves you no room to get out of the stream of water when it instantly goes from hot to ice cold, then back to scalding again. They obviously have some plumbing issues. If you can bring your own pillow, I would. The rooms are a little quirky but the grounds are pleasant, the pools wonderful and the location perfect. The mud bath is a fun and unique experience.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Dr. Wilkinson's Hot Springs Resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is the first time I have stayed at Dr. Wilkinson's Hot Springs Resort, in Calistoga, CA, I enjoyed myself so much I extended my stay 2 more nights. Every staff member that I came in contact during my stay was extremely friendly, helpfull and could not do enough to make my stay a pleasant one. This means a great deal to me as I have been in Customer Service and working with the public myself since 1971, so I know good service when I see if or encounter it. The pools, jacuzzi and spa treatments were wonderful. I have already recommended Dr. Wilkinson's to my friends and family and will return again. It has been so relaxing. It is within walking distance of shopping, grocery store, laundromat, wine tasting and more.

Reviews.Title: “total disappointment”
Reviews.Author: WaterwomanSF
Reviews.Content: i live in SF, and had hoped to find a place in calistoga where i could spend a few visits out of the year to unwind and relax.. regretfully, i left feeling more stressed than when i arrived.. the rooms are made of dully painted brick and concrete. the bed was not level.. so my feet were a bit higher than my head.. the pillows were flat.. the foot of the bed was right at the door to the room, the bathroom didn't have a bathtub.. the sink in the bathroom sprayed my jeans with water when i went to wash my hands. the aircon was extremely loud and distruptive to a good night's sleep. all of this for 125-175/night.. on the upside, the staff was very friendly, and the room was clean. the massage was great, but there aren't any private rooms, or partitions between - so you couldn't converse with your massage therapist in a normal tone of voice to describe where you have injuries or areas requiring extra work, etc. i ended up having to pay for two nights.. but left before the dinner hour on my second day - which i understand... but honestly, my bill came to roughly $500.. for one bad night of sleep in a lousy room.. the massage was great...

Reviews.Title: “Loved the mud bath!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a wonderful weekend at Dr. Wilkinson's. What a wonderful weekend. I have visited many spas in the area, and I must say I think this is my favorite. Get "the works"! It's truly a wonderful, relaxing afternoon. I highly recommed this spa.

Reviews.Title: “the best deal in Calistoga”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I live in the San Francisco bay area and have been going to Dr. Wilkinson's regularly since I moved here eight years ago. I have had consistently wonderful experiences. You can't beat the prices here... I highly recommend the "stress buster package" available during the off-season. It's the best deal for a spa treatment and an overnight in the napa valley. Dr. Wilkinson's is very conveniently located right in downtown Calistoga with lots of great shops and places to eat within walking distance. The staff at Dr. Wilkinson's are always attentive and helpful and the spa services are excellent. I consistently have excellent massages and always get "the works" treatment with the mud bath. (I recommend paying a little extra and getting an hour massage, if you get a spa package--it's so worth it. I always feel like a new person afterwards!) The rooms are cozy, beds are very comfortable and everything is very clean. There is lots of room to soak and lounge at their indoor hot mineral pool and the two outdoor mineral pools. I recommend Dr. Wilkinson's as the best deal in Calistoga (which is the best town for a getaway in the napa valley!). You can't beat the price! this is a great place to go with a friend or your sweetie... the rooms, service and spa treatments are consistently wonderful...

Reviews.Title: “Great for Couples Too”
Reviews.Author: SWfromSV
Reviews.Content: For years I have been going to Doc's with my girlfriends but had never spent a weekend there with my husband. Now I must tell you that it is a perfect retreat for couples too. We had a cute bungalow with a complete kitchen - clean, comfy, cozy, romantic. He also highly praised the men's spa treatments and enjoyed the three mineral pools. Great location for wine tasting and walking around the town.

Reviews.Title: “The BEST!!”
Reviews.Author: flowertripper
Reviews.Content: This was my second trip and I plan to make it an annual event! I thought I knew what "relaxed" meant until I experienced THE WORKS...now I know!! Quiet, delightful services, helpful staff. Other guests were also nice and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Great, relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: StephLP
Reviews.Content: My mother took me to Dr. Wilkenson's for my birthday. I had never been to a spa and wasn't quite sure what to expect. We had a great time! The hotel was emaculate. The staff was wonderful. Calistoga is a great, little town with some wonderful restaraunts. I highly recommend Dr. Wilkenson's and plan on returning with my husband.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great location. Large, beautiful rooms. Wonderful service at a great price. We'll be back very soon!!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Oasis”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a lovely setting for a relaxing get-away. Four ladies occupied one double room very comfortably, with quick access to the spa and pools. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Spa treatments very professional and worth a little drive to Calistoga.

Reviews.Title: “Most helpful attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: ageofaquariuschico
Reviews.Content: For the 3rd year I and three friends spent my birthday relaxing in Calistoga. We were greated at the front desk and as we waiting for out room (we were early) the young man at the desk, Jose, talked about working at Dr. Wilkinson's and about the Hideaway Cottages and answered all our questions as we are interested in bringing a larger group in the following year. We had signed up for our spa packages when we registered but when one friend became ill we needed to cancell her package, so early the next morning we were back and Jose again handled everything very professionally including personally getting us towels so the maid would not have to enter our room and disturb our friend as she tried to sleep. The remaining three had wonderful spa appointments with fantastic staff who treat each person like they are the only ones they are seeing for the day! All the front staff are helpful and friendly. The spa staff are fantastic and all support staff are friendly and helpful. Come and be treated like royalty.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have had the pleasure to stay at the hotel and get "The works" four times now. The experience just gets better. Everytime was a perfect pleasure, But now that I know the routine and town better I can truly maximize my enjoyment!!The staff is super professional, yet really friendly and the services are top notch. The focus seems to be on the services and less so on the room you stay in, which totally makes sense to me! I hope to spend a minimum of time in the room anyway-so It is perfectly comfortable, but not overdone. A+++++++ experience, cannot wait to go again soon!

Reviews.Title: “24 years of mud, mineral waters, massage and pilgrimmage”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As a couple, we travel at least once yearly (each winter for the past 24 years) to Doc W's for restoration and relaxation. While other spas may have the glitz, Doc's place has reliably comfortable and well-tested spa services (with lots of large and small special touches). The rooms are clean and quiet. The spa staff is welcoming, friendly and knowledgeable. Our health improves just thinking about this comforting get-away to the small-town calm of Calistoga!

Reviews.Title: “dr wilkinson's hot springs resort - great massage”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: the massage was excellent, the best i've ever had! the mineral bath was disappointing in that the tubs weren't filled high enough, and the water was not hot enough. it might have been that the bath attendants weren't paying attention. the next time, i'd skip the mineral bath and get a longer massage. there are mineral pools, indoor & outdoor to use instead of the mediocre mineral bath. however, overall, the staff were were helpful and professional. the rooms were clean and much larger than i had expected.

Reviews.Title: “Good in any Season”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We love Dr. Wilkinson's and continue to return. THose looking for elegant luxury may be dissapointed; Dr. Wilkinson's is more about simple, affordable relaxation. Their services are always exceptional -- we've had facials, massages and mudbaths over the years and have always been pleased as well as relaxed. Nothing beats their three mineral pools! The staff is knowlegeable, especially those in the services areas (mud baths, massage, facial) and on our last visit, I was particulary delighted with my facial, which took place in a plush, quiet and secluded "spa cottage". The rooms are spacious and lovely, the grounds quiet. We reccomend Dr. Wilkinson's to anyone, including families, looking for a simple, affordable rest. Those interested in high end pampering, the elegant "spa" thing, might want to stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “The best of it all in one place!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Doc's in Calistoga, A place that is excellent in all areas, the hotel rooms, are decorated great, roomy and very comfortable, the 3 pools are always sparkling at the right temp, the treatments oh my gosh, the best and I have tried other always come back to Doc's!

Reviews.Title: “a joke - rude staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: my husband treated me to what sounded like a perfect birthday gift at the spa. it was the thought that counted. this place is awful. the front desk woman was incredibly rude - it was almost laughable. the attends in the spa didn't seem to give a crap and it felt like a hospital-setting. massage was ok, nothing great. the setting is very dated. i do not recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service at a Paramount”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I went up there for Bridal Shower weekend. We only went for the spa, but had access to the other facilities all day. When the owner found out that it was a Bridal shower, he presented the Bride with a small gift. So why is the service paramount? Our battery happened to die in the parking lot, and none of my girlfriends had AAA, and we were far from anyone who could help us. No one had jumper cables. The owner used his own AAA card to help us out and even interupted his own scheduled plans to do so. So great service and great people. Dr. Wilkenson's ROCKS!

Reviews.Title: “It worked for what we needed...”
Reviews.Author: yohutch
Reviews.Content: We went to Calistoga for a friend's wedding and to celebrate my birthday, it was my first time as well as my boyfriend's. By the time we went to book rooms that were blocked for wedding guests at an adjacent hotel they were all full. By the advice of this site we went with Dr. Wilkinson's, for the price I hoped we'd be getting a great room. It was a bit pricey, more than we wanted to spend but we were pleasantly surprised... very nice linens, good sized room, a great courtyard to hang out and central location. Unfortunately we didn't get into the mineral pools but they looked relaxing. I got the "works" package, I loved the massage but could've done without the mud bath. Not that it was bad, it just wasn't my thing... kind of smelly and uncomfortable feeling restricted in that way.

Reviews.Title: “seems fishy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Dr. Wilkinson's is just ok. It seems fishy that there are so many high ratings. Also, the story lines on the reviews seem fake. For the price it is ok.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable relaxation and a great value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Dr. Wilkinson's Hot Springs Resort is the Honda Accord of Napa Valley accommodations--great value for the money, quite affordable compared to the competition, and enough luxury-esque touches to ensure comfort and satiisfaction. My wife and I, along with four other couples, stayed a long weekend in late June, and couldn't have been more pleased. The pluses are myriad: two fine outdoor pools (one heated), one huge indoor hot tub, serene courtyard patios, decent-sized and clean rooms, comfy beds, friendly staff, and just a half-block walk to the quaint downtown. If you're looking for more overt luxury, this probably isn't the place (for example, we loved the '60s era Formica bathroom counter, but others might not.) But if want a cozy, comfortable, conveniently located hotel that will leave you plenty of cash to spend on California Cabs, I'm not sure you can do better than this. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A stress reduced weekend at Dr. Wilkinson's”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We went to Dr. Wilkinson's 25 years ago for our wedding anniversary. We enjoyed it so much, we now go 3 times a year. They give us such a warm and friendly welcome. Everyone that works there is so pleasant and helpful. They have an indoor hot tub, 2 outdoor pools and a lovely patio. The location is convenient to all the restaurants in town. We start our weekend on Friday relaxing in our room and in the hot tub. The next morning we have their stress reducing "Works". A mud bath, mineral bath, steam room, blanket wrap and massage. Sunday we leave Calistoga rested and looking forward to our next trip to Dr. Wilkinson's

Reviews.Title: “mixed review”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: So I went because it was a X-mas gift from my fiancee and he bought me "the works." I had a mudd bath which was my first ever and I just have to say that it was a smelly experience and I wouldn't pay to do it again or even care to do it for free. They turn the mudd over with a shovel after you get out and the next person jumps in- my only saving thought was that the heat of the mud would I hope kill anything from the prior visitors (eww). Tiffany my massage therapist was great. The mineral bath was just ok- it was for only 10 minutes. If you are not used to women walking around naked or if you are body shy- DO NOT GO HERE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Mud?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The room we stayed in was next door to the spa and lovely. Very clean, romantic, and Victorian -- very charming. The massage (by Marcos) was excellent. He really knows what he is doing! The mud bath I could have done without. No privacy what-so-ever and they change the water from one customer to another, but you use the same mud you just watched the person before you climb out of! The "mud" feels and smells like peat moss. I wouldn't do it again. Friends who have visited other establishments in the area say the mud is claylike -- this was more like peat moss. Next time, I'd book an appointment for a massage with Marcos and stay somewhere else. Even though the room was very nice, the pool and surrounding areas really need some work.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a facelift!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed 12 - 14 July. Typical 70s motel style with no charm (except for the bath and massage staff!). Room was v small with no view, little light and minimal "love" given to the decor. It looked like it could use a makeover. Pools were great as was the mud bath (v unusual but good!), mineral bath and massage. Staff were friendly and looked after you with no hassles. Spa suffered from similar out-of-date decor as the room. Would not recommend it to my mother. All in all, it was adequate for the budget traveller, but I can't help but think that there is better value for the same price in Calistoga.

Reviews.Title: “The best spa in Calistoga”
Reviews.Author: goldinr
Reviews.Content: The masseurs at Dr. Wilkirson's are the best. Every time I am stressed out I take a visit to the spa and do the Works. The package includes a mud bath, wirlpool, steamroom, blanket wrap and massage.My favorite masseur is Marcos.I live in Napa Valley and have a great selection of spas to chose from but Dr. Wilkinson is clean, simple and efficient. It is my choice for myself, friends and family.My sister always stays at Dr. W's and is always treated very well. The rooms are large and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Dr. Wilkinson's.....my home away from home”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I first visited Dr. Wilkinson's about 5 years ago and I immeditely fell in love with the place. When first driving to Dr. Wilkinson's in the heart of Callistoga, one might think that they will be staying at a palace of fine relaxation with elaborate spas and pools, but when arriving you can see that it is a small quaint 70's style hot springs resort that prides itself on cleanliness and simple relaxation. You always feel welcome and the staff is very knowledgeable in what they do (I know from personal experience, because .every year I visit, the same staff continues to be there) It is such a nice feeling to see familiar faces. I just recently made a visit to Dr. Wilkinson's and enjoyed myself as I do every year! I will continue to have Dr. Wilkinson's Hot Springs Resort be a part of my family and tradition!

Reviews.Title: “the spa package”
Reviews.Author: marynj39
Reviews.Content: spent three nights during our honeymoon there.I thought our travel agent had reserved a cottage for us, but we stayed in room #34, the accomodations were nice, very clean & comfortable.If you decide to go for one of the spa packages, do yourself a favor & spend the extra money for an hour massage, it's well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Decent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: jamofour
Reviews.Content: A decent place to stay. Nothing fancy. But, the price was right. Rooms were very clean and comfortable. No real nice amenities, just basic cable, phone, coffee maker, blow-dryer, small refridgerator. The spa, is kind of funky. Very industrial feel to the spa. But, the massage was wonderful! The massage made up for the spa shortcomings. People were very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Dr. Wilkinson worst of the worst horror memoryand”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: f there were a rating worse than "Terrible" this resort would receive it. If you are looking for relaxation, do not go to Dr. Wilkinson's Hot Springs Resort They have the most rude and mentally unstable personnel an were very unwelcoming, obnoxious and mean. The employees will make your stay very unpleasant... So, instead of relaxation you'll get aggravation and a miserable, smelly memory from a trip to this dump.

HotelInfo.Name: Dr. Wilkinson's Hot Springs Resort
HotelInfo.Address: 1507 Lincoln Ave., Calistoga, CA 94515
